paper_experiments.paper_title: Low-resource Deep Entity Resolution with Transfer and Active Learning

datasets.name: DBLP-ACM
datasets.description: Citation dataset used for entity resolution experiments.
datasets.processing: Feature-based blocking and random splits; tokenized with NLTK and lowercased.

datasets.name: DBLP-Scholar
datasets.description: Citation dataset for entity resolution.
datasets.processing: Feature-based blocking and random splits; tokenized with NLTK and lowercased.

datasets.name: Cora
datasets.description: Citation dataset with 8 attributes in the schema; entity matching task.
datasets.processing: Candidate set of 50,000 pairs randomly sampled from jaccard similarity-based blocking.

datasets.name: Fodors-Zagats
datasets.description: Restaurant dataset for entity resolution.
datasets.processing: Feature-based blocking and random splits; tokenized and lowercased.

datasets.name: Amazon-Google
datasets.description: Product matching dataset.
datasets.processing: Feature-based blocking and random splits; tokenized and lowercased.

datasets.name: Zomato-Yelp
datasets.description: Restaurant dataset constructed by merging Restaurants 1 and 2 from Das et al. (2016); schemas differ slightly.
datasets.processing: Null value for zip code attribute in Restaurants 1 to avoid merging errors.

metrics.name: Precision
metrics.description: Fraction of correctly predicted positive pairs among all predicted positive pairs.

metrics.name: Recall
metrics.description: Fraction of correctly predicted positive pairs among all actual positive pairs.

metrics.name: F1
metrics.description: Harmonic mean of precision and recall.

baselines.name: Deep Learning (DL)
baselines.description: Deep learning model for entity resolution using deepmatcher library.

baselines.name: Deep Active Learning (DAL)
baselines.description: Active learning framework with deep models (random initialization).

baselines.name: Support Vector Machine (SVM)
baselines.description: Non-deep learning baseline using SVM algorithm from Magellan package.

baselines.name: Decision Tree
baselines.description: Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.

baselines.name: Random Forest
baselines.description: Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.

baselines.name: Naive Bayes
baselines.description: Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.

baselines.name: Logistic Regression
baselines.description: Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.

baselines.name: Linear Regression
baselines.description: Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.

baselines.name: Mudgal et al. (2018)
baselines.description: State-of-the-art deep learning method for entity resolution.

provenance.quote: only 100 active learning labels are needed to achieve the same performance as the model trained with all target labels (894 labels)

paper_experiments.paper_title: Cost-Effective In-Context Learning for Entity Resolution: A Design Space Exploration

datasets.name: WA
datasets.description: Part of Magellan benchmark; contains entities from two tables with labeled matching/non-matching entity pairs.

datasets.name: AB
datasets.description: Part of Magellan benchmark; contains entities from two tables with labeled matching/non-matching entity pairs.

datasets.name: AG
datasets.description: Amazon-Google: software products from Amazon and Google with three attributes (title, manufacturer, price); 11,460 entity pairs, 1,167 matches.

datasets.name: DS
datasets.description: Part of Magellan benchmark; contains entities from two tables with labeled matching/non-matching entity pairs.

datasets.name: DA
datasets.description: Part of Magellan benchmark; contains entities from two tables with labeled matching/non-matching entity pairs.

datasets.name: FZ
datasets.description: Part of Magellan benchmark; contains entities from two tables with labeled matching/non-matching entity pairs.

datasets.name: IA
datasets.description: Part of Magellan benchmark; contains entities from two tables with labeled matching/non-matching entity pairs.

datasets.name: Beer
datasets.description: Part of Magellan benchmark; small dataset with only 91 pairs for testing.

metrics.name: F1
metrics.description: Harmonic mean of Precision and Recall, measuring matching accuracy of entity resolution.

metrics.name: API Cost
metrics.description: Monetary cost for API calls to LLMs, measured in US dollars.

metrics.name: Labeling Cost
metrics.description: Monetary cost for labeling entity pairs to prepare demonstrations, estimated from crowdsourcing rates.

baselines.name: Ditto
baselines.description: PLM-based entity resolution using RoBerta and fine-tuning on labeled pairs.

baselines.name: JointBert
baselines.description: Dual-objective BERT model combining binary matching and multi-class classification for entity matching.

baselines.name: RobEM
baselines.description: Robust PLM-based ER method addressing data imbalance with modifications to enhance PLMs.

baselines.name: ManualPrompt
baselines.description: LLM-based ER (GPT-3) using manually designed prompts and demonstrations; standard prompting.

datasets.name: Cora
datasets.description: A text-based dataset comprising duplicate references to scientific publications; structured CSV version used.

datasets.name: Alaska
datasets.description: An e-commerce product dataset collected from multiple websites.

datasets.name: AS
datasets.description: Widely recognized for Dirty ER benchmarks.

datasets.name: DBLP-Google
datasets.description: Citation domain dataset containing bibliographic duplicates sourced from DBLP and Google Scholar.

datasets.name: Citeseer-DBLP
datasets.description: Citation domain dataset containing bibliographic duplicates sourced from Citeseer and DBLP.

datasets.name: Song
datasets.description: Music domain dataset including information from various platforms.

datasets.name: Music
datasets.description: Music 20K dataset, used for Dirty ER benchmarks; large-scale variants up to 50K records.

datasets.name: AmazonGoogle
datasets.description: Dataset from the Software domain, more specialized and complex ER tasks.

datasets.name: Walmart-Amazon
datasets.description: Dataset from the Electronics domain, more specialized and complex ER tasks.

metrics.name: Accuracy
metrics.description: Proportion of correctly clustered records according to the ground truth clusters.
metrics.formulation: \mathrm{ACC}=\frac{\text { CorrectCount }}{|\Re|} \quad \text { CorrectCount }=\sum_{X_{j} \in \mathbb{X}} \sum_{x \in X_{j}} \mathbb{I}(\exists y \in M_{j}^{\prime}, y=x)

metrics.name: FP-measure
metrics.description: Harmonic mean of purity and inverse-purity, evaluating clustering homogeneity and stability.

baselines.name: Booster
baselines.description: LLM-based ER method employing traditional blocking and iterative partition scoring.

baselines.name: BQ
baselines.description: Batch-Questioning: Batches pairwise match questions into a single prompt for LLMs.

baselines.name: CrowdER+LLM
baselines.description: Clustering-based design that filters irrelevant pairs and uses LLM to cluster ambiguous cases.

paper_experiments.paper_title: Sparkly: A Simple yet Surprisingly Strong TF/IDF Blocker for Entity Matching

datasets.name: Amazon-Google
datasets.description: Structured dataset with short atomic attributes; used for entity matching.

datasets.name: AmazonGoogle_2
datasets.description: Textual version derived from structured Amazon-Google dataset with 2-3 textual blob attributes.

datasets.name: Hospital
datasets.description: Private dataset for entity matching.

datasets.name: Songs
datasets.description: Structured dataset used for entity matching, large scale experiments.

datasets.name: BC
datasets.description: Big Citations: blocks two tables of 2.5M and 1.8M paper citations, with complete gold.

datasets.name: MB
datasets.description: Music Brainz: blocks a table of 20M songs (against itself), with complete gold.

datasets.name: WDC
datasets.description: Web Data Commons: blocks a table of 26M product descriptions; lacks complete gold.

metrics.name: Recall
metrics.description: Fraction of true matches retained after blocking; $R=|C \cap G| /|G|$, where $C$ is the blocking output and $G$ is the set of all gold matches.

metrics.name: Candidate Set Size Ratio
metrics.description: Ratio of candidate pairs output by the blocker to all possible pairs, $CSSR=|C| /|A \times B|$.

baselines.name: Autoencoder
baselines.description: Deep learning (DL) based blocker; one of the two best DL blockers.

baselines.name: Hybrid
baselines.description: Deep learning based blocker; one of the two best DL blockers.

baselines.name: Union(DL,RBB)
baselines.description: Combination of the best DL blocker and RBB, a SOTA industrial blocker.

baselines.name: PBW
baselines.description: SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.

baselines.name: DBW
baselines.description: SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.

baselines.name: JD
baselines.description: SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.

baselines.name: kNN-cosine
baselines.description: kNN blocker using cosine similarity over 5-gram tokenization.

baselines.name: kNN-jaccard
baselines.description: kNN blocker using Jaccard similarity over 3-gram and 5-gram tokenization.

provenance.quote: at recall of $98 \%$, Sparkly-Man achieves CSSR of $2.5 \%$, whereas the two DL blockers achieve CSSR of $10 \%$.
at recall of $98 \%$, Sparkly-Man achieves CSSR of $2.5 \%$
Sparkly achieves high recall on MB and BC at $k=50$.
We cannot compute recall for WDC as it does not have the complete gold.

paper_experiments.paper_title: Deep Indexed Active Learning for Matching Heterogeneous Entity Representations

datasets.name: Walmart-Amazon
datasets.description: Product dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
datasets.processing: Schema from DeepMatcher used; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

datasets.name: Amazon-Google
datasets.description: Product dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
datasets.processing: Schema from DeepMatcher used; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

datasets.name: DBLP-ACM
datasets.description: Citation dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

datasets.name: DBLP-Scholar
datasets.description: Citation dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

datasets.name: Abt-Buy
datasets.description: Product dataset; textual dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; CAND=20x|S| and k=20 for this dataset due to small |S|; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

datasets.name: MultiLingual
datasets.description: Multilingual entity matching dataset (English-German subset) from [26], originally proposed for machine translation of structured data; each element is a string in English or German (with HTML/XML tags)
datasets.processing: English-Deutsch subset; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; test set constructed similarly; uses multilingual BERT as base

metrics.name: Precision
metrics.description: Fraction of predicted duplicates that are correct

metrics.name: Recall
metrics.description: Fraction of true duplicates that are retrieved

metrics.name: F1
metrics.description: Harmonic mean of precision and recall, measuring accuracy of duplicate detection

baselines.name: PairedFixed
baselines.description: Non-adaptive blocking: candidate set via similarity search on pretrained TPLM embeddings; no task-specific finetuning

baselines.name: PairedAdapt
baselines.description: Embeddings from TPLM as finetuned by the matcher in paired mode; candidate set created as in PairedFixed

baselines.name: SentenceBERT
baselines.description: Finetunes TPLM and a SentenceBERT-like classifier on labeled data to obtain embeddings for similarity search; RoBERTa transformer used in this work

baselines.name: Rules
baselines.description: Blocking based on hand-crafted rules (human-designed), applied to five benchmark datasets

baselines.name: Random Forest
baselines.description: Ensemble of 20 decision trees using learner-aware Query By Committee (QBC); strong active learning baseline for entity resolution

baselines.name: JedAI:Schema-based
baselines.description: JedAI toolkit schema-based pipeline; similarity joins for blocking; best configuration per [47]

baselines.name: JedAI:Schema-agnostic
baselines.description: JedAI toolkit schema-agnostic pipeline; leverages all attributes to extract overlapping blocks; best configuration per [47]

baselines.name: PairedFixed (MultiLingual)
baselines.description: Non-adaptive blocking for MultiLingual dataset; candidate set via similarity search on pretrained multilingual BERT embeddings

baselines.name: PairedAdapt (MultiLingual)
baselines.description: Adaptive blocking for MultiLingual dataset; embeddings from multilingual BERT as finetuned by the matcher in paired mode

paper_experiments.paper_title: MinoanER: Schema-Agnostic, Non-Iterative, Massively Parallel Resolution of Web Entities

baselines.description: State-of-the-art entity resolution method.

datasets.name: Song-Song $_{1}$
datasets.description: Structured EM dataset; 1,000,000 and 1,000,000 tuples in Table A/B, 1,292,023 matches, 5 attributes

datasets.name: Amazon-Google $_{2}$
datasets.description: Textual EM dataset (derived from Amazon-Google $_{1}$); 2 textual blob attributes

datasets.name: Walmart-Amazon $_{2}$
datasets.description: Textual EM dataset (derived from Walmart-Amazon $_{1}$); 2 textual blob attributes

datasets.name: Abt-Buy
datasets.description: Textual EM dataset; 1,081 and 1,092 tuples in Table A/B, 1,097 matches, 3 textual attributes

datasets.name: DBLP-ACM $_{2}$
datasets.description: Dirty EM dataset (synthetically corrupted from DBLP-ACM $_{1}$); 4 attributes

datasets.name: Hospital $_{2}$
datasets.description: Dirty EM dataset (synthetically corrupted from Hospital $_{1}$); 7 attributes

datasets.name: Song-Song $_{2}$
datasets.description: Dirty EM dataset (synthetically corrupted from Song-Song $_{1}$); 5 attributes

datasets.name: Restaurants
datasets.description: Real-world dirty EM dataset; contains noise such as misspellings, missing values, incorrect entries

datasets.name: Books
datasets.description: Real-world dirty EM dataset; contains noise such as misspellings, missing values, incorrect entries

datasets.name: Cora
datasets.description: Real-world dirty EM dataset; contains noise such as misspellings, missing values, incorrect entries

metrics.name: Recall
metrics.description: Fraction of true matches covered by the candidate set after blocking

metrics.name: Candidate Set Size Ratio
metrics.description: Fraction of all possible pairs selected as candidates; lower is better

baselines.name: RBB
baselines.description: State-of-the-art industrial non-DL solution that uses labeled data to learn a blocker

baselines.name: BSL
baselines.description: Blocking Scheme Learner; learns a blocker from labeled data

baselines.name: TB
baselines.description: Token Blocking; unsupervised schema-agnostic approach

baselines.name: AutoBlock
baselines.description: DL method that learns tuple embeddings using labeled data and LSH for retrieval

baselines.name: DeepER
baselines.description: Existing DL solution for blocking

baselines.name: DeepBlock
baselines.description: Existing DL solution; marginally uses DL to improve a non-DL blocking solution

paper_experiments.paper_title: ZeroEA: A Zero-Training Entity Alignment Framework via Pre-Trained Language Model

datasets.name: DBP15K
datasets.description: Well-recognized benchmark for entity alignment, containing three smaller subsets for cross-lingual EA, each with 15,000 aligned entity pairs.

datasets.name: DWY100K
datasets.description: Comprises two subsets of a medium scale for monolingual EA, each including 100,000 aligned entity pairs and around one million triples.

datasets.name: DBP1M
datasets.description: Large EA benchmark with two cross-lingual subsets, each with over one million entities and nearly ten million triples.

datasets.name: SPIDER
datasets.description: Large-scale, complex, and cross-domain text-to-SQL dataset; 10,181 questions, 5,693 unique SQL queries, over 200 databases across 138 domains.

metrics.name: Hits@1
metrics.description: Fraction of correct entities ranked at position 1.

metrics.name: Hits@10
metrics.description: Fraction of correct entities ranked within top 10.

metrics.name: MRR
metrics.description: Mean Reciprocal Rank; average of reciprocal ranks for correct entities.

metrics.name: Precision
metrics.description: Proportion of predicted links that are correct.

metrics.name: Recall
metrics.description: Proportion of true links that are recovered.

metrics.name: F1
metrics.description: Harmonic mean of precision and recall.

metrics.name: Exact Match (EM)
metrics.description: Measures whether the predicted SQL exactly matches the ground truth.

metrics.name: Execution Accuracy (EX)
metrics.description: Measures whether the execution result of the predicted SQL matches the ground truth.

baselines.name: Graphix-base
baselines.description: Baseline text-to-SQL model using schema linking via string matching.

baselines.name: Graphix-TransE
baselines.description: Graphix-base model with TransE-based schema linking.

baselines.name: Graphix-GCN
baselines.description: Graphix-base model with GCN-based schema linking.

provenance.quote: On DBP1M_FR-EN, ZeroEA obtains Hit@1= 0.594 , Hit@10=0.635, and MRR =0.400
On DBP1M_FR-EN, ZeroEA obtains Hit@1= 0.594 , Hit@10=0.635, and MRR =0.400
On DBP1M_FR-EN, ZeroEA obtains Hit@1= 0.594 , Hit@10=0.635, and MRR =0.400
on DBP1M_DE-EN, ZeroEA obtains Hit@1= 0.616, Hit@10=0.648, and MRR =0.395
on DBP1M_DE-EN, ZeroEA obtains Hit@1= 0.616, Hit@10=0.648, and MRR =0.395
on DBP1M_DE-EN, ZeroEA obtains Hit@1= 0.616, Hit@10=0.648, and MRR =0.395

paper_experiments.paper_title: Dealing with Acronyms, Abbreviations, and Typos in Real-World Entity Matching

datasets.name: Police ROSTER
datasets.description: 31,516 rows of police officer data; uses the 'Title' column with 154 distinct values (99 standard, 55 modified forms)

datasets.name: Large Disease
datasets.description: 405,543 rows of medical data relating to disease; each row stores a medical term with standard and modified forms; many acronyms and abbreviations but not misspellings; evaluated on a 30,000 row sample

datasets.name: Small Disease
datasets.description: Subset of Large Disease; includes 634 disease names; pairs of standard and modified disease names

datasets.name: Location
datasets.description: Dataset including location names (e.g., street and city names); ground truth contains 116 pairs of standard and modified names referring to the same location

metrics.name: Precision
metrics.description: Proportion of correctly identified positive matches among all returned matches

metrics.name: Recall
metrics.description: Proportion of correctly identified positive matches among all true matches

metrics.name: F-score
metrics.description: Harmonic mean of precision and recall, measuring the overall match accuracy

baselines.name: Levenshtein distance
baselines.description: Edit distance metric for string similarity

baselines.name: Affine gap distance
baselines.description: Edit distance metric with different penalties for gaps

baselines.name: Jaccard-Word
baselines.description: Tokenizes strings into sets of words and computes the Jaccard score

baselines.name: Jaccard-NG
baselines.description: Creates n-grams (3-grams) for strings and computes Jaccard score over n-gram sets

baselines.name: pkduck
baselines.description: Synonym rules-based approach for string matching

baselines.name: Bipartite
baselines.description: Set similarity approach using a bipartite graph; similarity is minimal sum of edge weights divided by number of edges; edge weights evaluated with Jaccard-NG

baselines.name: ChatGPT (GPT-4.0)
baselines.description: Large language model-based approach to string matching

canonical_datasets.description: Citation dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: Citation dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: A text-based dataset comprising duplicate references to scientific publications; structured CSV version used.
Restaurant matching dataset from the Magellan repository for entity resolution.
Product dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Schema from DeepMatcher used; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: Restaurant dataset constructed by merging Restaurants 1 and 2 from Das et al. (2016); schemas differ slightly.
canonical_datasets.processing: Null value for zip code attribute in Restaurants 1 to avoid merging errors.

canonical_datasets.description: Contains descriptions of restaurants and their addresses from two different KBs; popular benchmark created by the Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative.
BeerAdvo-RateBeer; beer domain, structured ER benchmark
clean version of iTunes-Amazon; music domain, structured ER benchmark
Product dataset; textual dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; CAND=20x|S| and k=20 for this dataset due to small |S|; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: A dataset from the Alaska benchmark for entity matching.
An e-commerce product dataset collected from multiple websites.
Widely recognized for Dirty ER benchmarks.
Citation domain dataset containing bibliographic duplicates sourced from DBLP and Google Scholar.
Citation domain dataset containing bibliographic duplicates sourced from Citeseer and DBLP.
Music domain dataset including information from various platforms.
Music 20K dataset, used for Dirty ER benchmarks; large-scale variants up to 50K records.
Product dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Schema from DeepMatcher used; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: Contains descriptions of publications and their authors; matches between both publications and authors.
Contains descriptions of musicians, bands and their birthplaces, from BBCmusic and the BTC2012 version of DBpedia; highly heterogeneous schema and values.
Contains descriptions of movie-related entities (e.g., actors, directors, movies) from YAGO and IMDb; largest and most balanced KB pair.

Semi-structured, homogeneous schema entity matching dataset from Machamp

Semi-structured and textual entity matching dataset (word) from Machamp
Relational and textual entity matching dataset from Machamp

Private dataset for entity matching.
Big Citations: blocks two tables of 2.5M and 1.8M paper citations, with complete gold.
Music Brainz: blocks a table of 20M songs (against itself), with complete gold.
Web Data Commons: blocks a table of 26M product descriptions; lacks complete gold.

Multilingual entity matching dataset (English-German subset) from [26], originally proposed for machine translation of structured data; each element is a string in English or German (with HTML/XML tags)
canonical_datasets.processing: English-Deutsch subset; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; test set constructed similarly; uses multilingual BERT as base

Matches movies and TV series extracted from IMDB and TheTVDB [19]

canonical_metrics.description: Proportion of predicted matches that are correct.
Proportion of ground truth matches that are correctly predicted.
Harmonic mean of precision and recall.
Monetary cost for API calls to LLMs, measured in US dollars.
Monetary cost for labeling entity pairs to prepare demonstrations, estimated from crowdsourcing rates.
Proportion of correctly clustered records according to the ground truth clusters.
canonical_metrics.formulation: \mathrm{ACC}=\frac{\text { CorrectCount }}{|\Re|} \quad \text { CorrectCount }=\sum_{X_{j} \in \mathbb{X}} \sum_{x \in X_{j}} \mathbb{I}(\exists y \in M_{j}^{\prime}, y=x)

canonical_metrics.description: Harmonic mean of purity and inverse-purity, evaluating clustering homogeneity and stability.
Ratio of candidate pairs output by the blocker to all possible pairs, $CSSR=|C| /|A \times B|$.
Fraction of correct entities ranked at position 1.
Fraction of correct entities ranked within top 10.
Mean Reciprocal Rank; average of reciprocal ranks for correct entities.
Measures whether the predicted SQL exactly matches the ground truth.
Measures whether the execution result of the predicted SQL matches the ground truth.

canonical_baselines.description: Deep learning model for entity resolution using deepmatcher library.
Active learning framework with deep models (random initialization).
Non-deep learning baseline using SVM algorithm from Magellan package.
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
Ensemble of 20 decision trees using learner-aware Query By Committee (QBC); strong active learning baseline for entity resolution
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
State-of-the-art deep learning method for entity resolution.
Supervised ER model; fine-tunes a pre-trained language model for sentence-pair classification.
Dual-objective BERT model combining binary matching and multi-class classification for entity matching.
Robust PLM-based ER method addressing data imbalance with modifications to enhance PLMs.
LLM-based ER (GPT-3) using manually designed prompts and demonstrations; standard prompting.
DeepMatcher+, a reference DL-based EM approach that does not rely on a transformer architecture.
Unsupervised, generative ER approach using Gaussian Mixture Models
Unsupervised, learns local embeddings for ER based on attribute-centric graphs
Supervised, integrates schematic and structural information with GNN for ER
Supervised, uses attention mechanism in sequence-based model for ER
Supervised, generative adversarial network for label augmentation in ER
DITTO using pseudo labels generated by CollaborER's ALG
Unsupervised framework that constructs rule-based pseudo labels and combines graph and sentence features.
Iterative active-learning-based entity matching method allocating annotation budget to informative pairs.
DITTO trained with the full training data of the processed Magellan datasets.
Large language model (65B) with 10-shot in-context learning.
Large language model (175B parameters) with 10-shot in-context learning.
Pre-trained SBERT used as a blocker.
Blocker baseline for candidate generation.
Blocker baseline for candidate generation.
LLM-based ER method employing traditional blocking and iterative partition scoring.
Batch-Questioning: Batches pairwise match questions into a single prompt for LLMs.
Clustering-based design that filters irrelevant pairs and uses LLM to cluster ambiguous cases.
Entity matching framework using RNNs to aggregate attribute values
Fine-tuned for entity matching as a sequence pair classification task
Finetunes TPLM and a SentenceBERT-like classifier on labeled data to obtain embeddings for similarity search; RoBERTa transformer used in this work
Transfer learning-based EM framework via domain adaptation
Meta-learning framework for data selection/weighting to better fine-tune LMs
Unsupervised approach using graph creation and random walk for structured/text data
TDmatch embeddings with an MLP classifier in supervised setting
Deep learning (DL) based blocker; one of the two best DL blockers.
Deep learning based blocker; one of the two best DL blockers.
Combination of the best DL blocker and RBB, a SOTA industrial blocker.
SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.
SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.
SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.
kNN blocker using cosine similarity over 5-gram tokenization.
kNN blocker using Jaccard similarity over 3-gram and 5-gram tokenization.
Binary classifier for weight-based supervised meta-blocking
Cardinality-based pruning algorithm
Cardinality-based pruning algorithm
Original supervised meta-blocking framework using BCI and CNP with the feature set proposed in [25]
Non-adaptive blocking: candidate set via similarity search on pretrained TPLM embeddings; no task-specific finetuning
Embeddings from TPLM as finetuned by the matcher in paired mode; candidate set created as in PairedFixed
Blocking based on hand-crafted rules (human-designed), applied to five benchmark datasets

JedAI toolkit schema-agnostic pipeline; leverages all attributes to extract overlapping blocks; best configuration per [47]

Adaptive blocking for MultiLingual dataset; embeddings from multilingual BERT as finetuned by the matcher in paired mode
